title: Hugh Grant expecting fourth child in four years: report
text:
Hugh Grant's life will soon be "About a Boy" — or girl — all over again.
The Golden Globe-winning British actor, 55, expects his fourth child in as many years, Entertainment Tonight has confirmed. The baby will be his second with Swedish TV producer Anna Eberstein, who was recently photographed in London with a baby bump.
The "Love Actually" star has ping-ponged between two baby mamas in a tangled timeline of childbirths.
He first welcomed a daughter , Tabitha Jing Xi (translation from Chinese: "happy surprise") in September 2011, the product of what his rep called "a fleeting affair" with a woman named Tinglan Hong.
Andy Kropa/Invision/AP Hugh Grant is expecting his fourth child in as many years, according to a report. Enlarge XPOS/Xposure/AKM-GSI The mother, Anna Eberstein, was recently photographed in London with a baby bump. Enlarge Hugh Grant is expecting his fourth child in as many years, according to a report. The mother, Anna Eberstein (r.), was recently seen in London with a baby bump.
A year later, Eberstein gave birth to Grant's second child, son John Mungo. Grant reunited with Hong in 2013 to produce his third offspring, son Felix.
The actor confirmed Felix’s arrival in a Twitter announcement, but made no mention of John Mungo. That news reportedly only came to light when John Mungo’s birth certificate was re-registered with Grant's name.
It's unclear whether the two mothers knew they were both pregnant by Grant at the same time.
Jean Catuffe/Getty Images The child will reportedly be Grant's second with Swedish TV producer Anna Eberstein. "We are very close friends. She is a wonderful mother," Grant previously told Swedish tabloid Aftonbladet of Eberstein, adding that he sees their son John Mungo "almost every day."
The actor's last serious relationship was with heiress Jemima Khan, from whom he split in 2007. Before Khan, he dated "Royals" star Elizabeth Hurley for 13 years.
Grant is a "10" in the bedroom, Hurley told "Watch What Happens Live" host Andy Cohen in March.
